Wise decision to get your acoustic guitar serviced! A proper setup can make a huge difference in playability and comfort.

The cost of a guitar setup can vary depending on the location, the type of guitar, and the technician's expertise. However, here are some general estimates:

* Basic setup: $20-$50 - This typically includes adjusting the action (string height), intonation, and tuning machines.
* Standard setup: $50-$100 - This includes the basic setup, plus adjustments to the neck, bridge, and fretboard, as well as cleaning and lubricating the fretboard and tuning machines.
* Deluxe setup: $100-$200 - This includes the standard setup, plus more extensive work such as fret leveling, crowning, and polishing, as well as upgrading the strings and installing new bridge pins (if needed).
* Custom setup: $200-$500+ - This is a comprehensive setup that includes all the above, plus custom adjustments to suit your playing style, such as changing the neck relief, adjusting the string spacing, or installing a new nut or saddle.

Keep in mind that these are rough estimates, and the final cost may vary depending on the technician's expertise, the guitar's condition, and the level of work required.

It's also worth noting that some guitar shops or technicians may offer package deals or discounts for students, beginners, or loyal customers. Be sure to ask about any promotions or discounts when you schedule your appointment.

Before taking your guitar in for a setup, it's a good idea to discuss your specific issues with the technician, such as the high action causing discomfort in your left hand. This will help them understand your needs and provide a more accurate estimate of the work required.
